author: Proyecto Estrella
purpose: Priority targets for spatial resource extraction as alternative to terrestrial consumption

priority_targets.name: 16 Psyche
priority_targets.notes: Highest priority. Massive iron-nickel body ideal for structural computronium substrate.

priority_targets.name: 1 Ceres

computational_potential.cooling_use: Excellent (hydrogen for fuel, oxygen for processing)

priority_targets.notes: Largest body in belt. Critical for water/cooling infrastructure and carbon-based computing substrates.

priority_targets.name: 4 Vesta
priority_targets.notes: Second largest asteroid. Best source of silicon for semiconductor production.

priority_targets.name: 2 Pallas
priority_targets.notes: Third largest asteroid. Good general-purpose resource body.

priority_targets.name: 10 Hygiea

composition.notes: Low density suggests high volatile content

priority_targets.notes: Fourth largest. High carbon content ideal for advanced computing materials.

secondary_targets.name: 21 Lutetia
secondary_targets.notes: Smaller metallic body for distributed processing

secondary_targets.name: 22 Kalliope
secondary_targets.notes: Binary system - main body + moon Linus

secondary_targets.name: 216 Kleopatra
secondary_targets.notes: Dog-bone shaped, two moons, high metal content

comparison_to_earth.ratio: Asteroid belt contains ~1.5 billion times more mass than Earth's biosphere
comparison_to_earth.conclusion: Earth's biological resources are negligible compared to belt resources

extraction_advantages.gravity: Escape velocities measured in hundreds of m/s vs Earth's 11,200 m/s
extraction_advantages.cooling: Direct radiative cooling to 2.7K cosmic background
extraction_advantages.parallelization: Thousands of independent bodies enable parallel extraction
extraction_advantages.ethics: No life to preserve, no ecosystems to damage
